Job Description: Job Description  The Bureau of Recycling and Sustainability (BRS) runs waste reduction and diversion programs and develops and administers policies to support the Departmentâs advancement towards zero waste to landfills. BRS also provides the Departmentâs outreach and education related to zero waste initiatives and engages strategic partnerships to expand the reach of our work and programs. BRS is currently seeking a competent, experienced, and innovative procurement analyst to research, support, and resource the procurement functions of the bureauâs programmatic portfolio of work.   Reporting to the Director of Finance & Administration with varying degrees of latitude for independent initiative, judgment, and decision making, the successful candidate will oversee the procurement of services and goods for the various programs within BRS to assist them in achieving their respective missions, while ensuring that procurement processes comply with all Procurement Policy Board (PPB) rules and applicable laws and mandates. BRS procurement analyst will also liaises with the Mayorâs Office of Contract Services (MOCS), Department of Citywide Administration Services (DCAS), Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and the Comptrollerâs office on behalf of BRS, with respect to procurement related issues.  Responsibilities  â¢	Prepare documentation for solicitation of goods and services; checking specifications for adequacy; analyzing bids and proposals for fair and reasonable pricing and/or responsiveness; and assessing whether bidders are responsible. â¢	Perform contracting functions in FMS, PASSPort, PIP, and other City information systems to prepare contracts for registration, including conducting responsibility determinations, ensuring vendor registration in required data systems, coordinating contract execution, and securing required approvals â¢	Ensuring contract compliance through the analysis of documents; preparing, reviewing, and modifying contract specifications; and making funding recommendations on existing contracts â¢	Interact with agency divisions, legal and Fiscal, as well as vendors and oversight agencies to receive and provide clarification on procurement actions â¢	Ensuring compliance with SBSâ Minority/Women Business Enterprise (MWBE) participation goals established by Local Law 1 â¢	Assist with the bureauâs MWBE requirements by educating vendors on our internal procurement process and providing technical assistance when necessary to enhance their ability to submit bids â¢	Working with BRS Program managers to gather information required to create solicitation documents for all contracts, requesting allocation of funding, obtaining agency approvals, and registration. â¢	Collaborating with Department ACCO and DACCOs to ensure efficacy of bureauâs procurement needs and requirements  *Candidate will be required to work OT as needed
Minimum Qual Requirements: 1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and six months of satisfactory full-time professional experience in procurement of goods, services, construction or construction-related services, or professional, technical or administrative experience in contract negotiation/management; or  2. An associate degree or completion of 60 semester credits from an accredited college, and 18 months of satisfactory, full-time professional experience as described in â1â above; or  3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and two and one-half years of satisfactory full time professional experience as described in â1â above; or  4. A combination of education and/or experience equivalent to â1â, â2â, or â3â above. College education may be substituted for professional experience under â2â or â3â above at the rate of 30 semester credits from an accredited college for 6 months of experience. However, all candidates must have at least a four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and 6 months of the experience described in â1â above.  SPECIAL NOTES:  To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, either one year served at Assignment Level I or one additional year of the experience described in 1 above.  To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level III, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, either one year served at Assignment Level II or two additional years of the experience described in 1 above, at least one year of which must have been supervisory, or spent performing professional procurement duties equivalent to those performed at Assignment Level III.
Preferred Skills: â¢	Strong communications skills; ability to tailor complex messages to diverse audiences. â¢	Strong administrative, organizational, interpersonal, writing, and data management skills. â¢	Proficiency in use of word processing and data management applications including MS Word and Excel â¢	Possession of a New York State Motor Vehicle Driverâs License.

Job Category: Constituent Services & Community Programs Legal Affairs
Job Description: MUST BE SERVING PERMANENTLY IN THE CLERICAL ASSOCIATE TITLE OR IN A COMPARABLE PERMANENT TITLE TO APPLY.  The Prosecution Division is responsible for the prosecution of all summonses issued by the TLC. The prosecution division includes the Court Unit which investigates and prosecutes over 100,000 summonses each year, and the Consumer Complaint Unit which initiates and prosecute complaints brought by consumers including but not limited to passengers and licensees. TLCs role is to promote the highest standards of safety and consumer protection in the industries we regulate. TLC is seeking a dynamic and motivated individual to help the Agency continue its work to develop a modern, innovative approach to the prosecution process with the key goals of (1) providing excellent customer service to our clients, and (2) improving the efficiency of our internal operations. Under the supervision of the Prosecution Coordinator, the duties of the selected candidate will include but may not be limited to the following: Process settlement offers in TAMIS, process payment plans for drivers, create/remove suspensions and revocations, enter information and data into the Agency database, retrieve data as necessary, respond to questions from the public via phone or in person and provide general direction as appropriate, utilize excellent customer service skills and use of translation services when needed. The selected candidate will also assist with other case support related duties as needed.
Minimum Qual Requirements: Qualification Requirements  A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or a recognized accrediting organization and one year of satisfactory clerical experience.  Skills Requirement  Keyboard familiarity with the ability to type at a minimum of 100 key strokes (20 words) per minute.
Preferred Skills: Skilled in effective, clear and persuasive oral and written communications. A writing sample will be requested as part of the hiring process. A candidates bi-lingual ability will be a strong component in the selection process. Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.  Aptitude for multi-tasking.  Analytical and aptitude for problem solving. Customer Service experience. Ability to adapt to a fluid work environment and changing needs and priorities. Strong computer skills; specifically, Microsoft applications, including but not limited to Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Project and Outlook.
To Apply: Click, APPLY NOW Current city employees must apply via Employee Self-Service (ESS)
Residency Requirement: New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Job Description: DSNY's Operations Management Division (OMD) is seeking to replace the outgoing Director of its operations research unit. The agencyâs operations research team provides empirically validated decision support and analytical solutions for operations managers and policy makers across the largest municipally operated waste management authority in the world with an annual budget of $1.7 billion. Its highly skilled staff includes data scientists, statisticians and GIS experts who employ a variety of techniques and technologies to solve problems and conduct analyses that help DSNY deliver services and new programs to the public. As Director of OMD Operations Research, one of the roles is to continue development of DSNYs in house route management application, Ruto along with developing a strategic plan for route digitization and route analytics. The Ruto application has allowed OMD, OAU and other DSNY Divisions to digitize cleaning, collections and snow routes, and is actively used for development of new routes (e.g., Brine, Protected Bike Lanes, Curbside Composting etc.) and updating / editing of existing routes.  The Director of Operations research will be tasked with significant responsibilities to support OMDs advanced route analytics systems development, continuation of the Curbside Composting opt-in program, and DSNYs increasing IT security responsibilities. The Director of Operations Research will also be tasked to develop new security modules and upgrade Ruto systems to comply with BIT practices for cyber security and IT security monitoring. Additionally, the Director will be tasked with advanced QA/QC analyses for DSNY Automatic Vehicle Location (AVL) data, with a particular focus on integration of new version of AVL hardware with existing AVL data and AVL-dependent applications.   The Director of Operations Research will also be required to have on-call availability for OMD systems during snow events, Sunday snow training sessions, and emergency response events.
Minimum Qual Requirements: 1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience in Information Technology (IT) including applications development, systems development, data communications and networking, database administration, data processing, or user services. At least eighteen (18) months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of applications development, systems development, data communications and networking, database administration, data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and four (4) years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience as described in 1 above; or  3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, and six (6) years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience as described in 1 above; or  4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to 1, 2 or 3 above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and must possess at least three (3) years of experience as described in 1 above, including the eighteen (18) months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in 1 above.   In the absence of a baccalaureate degree, undergraduate credits may be substituted for a maximum of two (2) years of the required experience in IT on the basis of 30 semester credits for six (6) months of the required experience. Graduate credits in computer science may be substituted for a maximum of one (1) year of the required experience in IT on the basis of 30 graduate semester credits in computer science for one (1) year of the required IT experience. However, undergraduate and/or graduate credits may not be substituted for the eighteen (18) months of experience in an administrative, managerial, executive, or supervisory capacity as described in 1 above.
Preferred Skills: The successful candidate should have several years of experience managing operations research or analogous functions of an operationally complex organization. Several of those years must have been managing staff conducting such work. Weâre also looking for the following: â¢	Proven track record planning and managing high-level quantitative research and mathematical modeling projects. â¢	Strong statistical analysis skills and a demonstrated awareness of how to pair the appropriate analytical method with the target question. â¢	Expertise in geospatial data, front-end application development, solutions architecture, and systems integration. â¢	Python scripting and analytical libraries, especially those relating to statistics, simulation, and optimization â¢	Experience managing the automation of manual analytical processes â¢	GIS experience (Esri ecosystem as well as open source) â¢	In-depth understanding of machine learning techniques and concepts â¢	Familiarity with architecting technical infrastructure that supports analytical functions and activities  â¢	Ability to work productively with a wide range of personalities and work styles â¢	Exceptional written and verbal presentation skills and significant experience presenting to high-level executives â¢	Passion for public work
Additional Information: IMPORTANT: Candidate must be permanent or be reachable on Exam # 9011 in the Computer Systems Manager title to apply.

Job Description: The New York City Department of Correction (DOC) is an integral part of the Cityâs evolving criminal justice system, participating in reform initiatives and strategies aimed to move the city towards the smallest jail system possible without compromising public safety. The DOC is solely responsible for maintaining a safe and secure environment for staff, providers, visitors, volunteers, and people in custody inside our jails. Importantly, safe jails enable DOC to providing people in custody with the tools and opportunities they need to successfully re-enter their communities. The DOC operates facilities and court commands across the five boroughs with more than 9,500 diverse professionals and knowledgeable experts.  The Division of Programs and Community Partnerships is comprised of thirteen units, some of which are: Arts, Budget & Contracts, Chaplaincy, Counseling/RMAS, Data Management, Educational Services, Law Libraries, Program Development & Operations, PAWS of Purpose, Recreational Services, Tablet Program, Volunteer Service Providers, and Workforce Development. Its mission is to empower individuals in our custody through the implementation of evidence-based programming and correctional best practices, leading to safer facilities and increased public safety.  The Division seeks to recruit a Human Resources Liaison to serve under the guidance of the Deputy Commissioner.    Additional typical duties for this position include but are not limited to: â¢	Maintain job postings, tracking vacancies, reviewing resumes, assistance with timekeeping,    maintaining a catalog of position descriptions in accordance with the Agencyâs policies and procedures. â¢	Create and preserve organizational charts and employeesâ rosters. â¢	Review applications/resumes, schedule and conduct telephone screenings, schedule    in-person interviews and complete all relevant internal processes; plus participating on the    interview panel, and other related duties.    â¢	Prepare reports and document interactions, complete progress notes, and use other tools as assigned.  â¢	Work on a multidisciplinary team with non-uniform and uniform members of staff. â¢	Perform other related duties as assigned.
Minimum Qual Requirements: Qualification Requirements  1. High school graduation or equivalent and three years of experience in community work or community centered activities in an area related to duties described above; or  2. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to 1 above.
Preferred Skills: â¢	Knowledge of the criminal justice system and experience working with multiple levels of staff within    the chain of command.  â¢	Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality, while maintaining effective working relationships with    all levels of correctional staff.  â¢	Ability to exercise independent judgment, prepare written reports and documents.  â¢	Must have a strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite Tools such as Word,    Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Visio.
Additional Information: The City of New York offers a comprehensive benefits package including health insurance for the employee and his/her spouse or domestic partner and unemancipated children under age 26, union benefits such as dental and vision coverage, paid annual leave and sick leave, paid holidays, a pension, and optional savings and pre-tax programs such as Deferred Compensation, IRA, and a flexible spending account
